extendedIngredients.name: coconut butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups coconut butter (you can use homemade or store bought)

extendedIngredients.name: peppermint extract
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 - 1 tsp peppermint extract (depending on how strong you like it)
metaInformation: (depending on how strong you like it)

recipes.title: 4 Ingredient Peppermint Fudge
recipes.instructions: In a food processor, combine all the ingredients.  Mix until smooth. Line an 8x8 pan with parchment paper, leaving enough room to come out the sides. Using a silicone spatula, transfer the mixture to the 8x8 baking dish.  Press the top down firmly. Sprinkle some of the candy can dust on top. Place in the fridge for a bit to firm up.  It should not take long at all. Using a knife or pizza wheel, but into squares.

steps.step: In a food processor, combine all the ingredients.

Mix until smooth. Line an 8x8 pan with parchment paper, leaving enough room to come out the sides. Using a silicone spatula, transfer the mixture to the 8x8 baking dish.  Press the top down firmly. Sprinkle some of the candy can dust on top.
Place in the fridge for a bit to firm up.  It should not take long at all. Using a knife or pizza wheel, but into squares.
